skill.name: scanpy
skill.description: Single-cell RNA-seq analysis. Load .h5ad/10X data, QC, normalization, PCA/UMAP/t-SNE, Leiden clustering, marker genes, cell type annotation, trajectory, for scRNA-seq analysis.
skill.summary: Single-cell RNA-seq analysis. Load .h5ad/10X data, QC, normalization, PCA/UMAP/t-SNE, Leiden cluster...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and local analysis scripts for Scanpy workflows. No network calls, credential access, or execution of remote code were found.

content.user_title: Run single cell RNA seq workflows
content.value_statement: Single cell analysis has many steps and parameters. This skill provides a complete Scanpy workflow with QC, clustering, and plots.
actual_capabilities: Load .h5ad, 10X, or CSV data and report dataset size
Calculate QC metrics and filter cells and genes by thresholds
Generate QC and embedding plots with saved figure files
Run PCA, neighbors, UMAP, and Leiden clustering workflows
Identify marker genes and export results to CSV files
Annotate cell types with a user defined mapping
limitations: Requires a Python environment with Scanpy and dependencies installed
Cell type annotations are manual and require domain knowledge
Does not perform automatic batch correction or integration by default
Assumes input data conforms to AnnData or 10X conventions

use_cases.title: QC and filtering
use_cases.description: Run standardized QC, filter low quality cells, and save a cleaned AnnData file.

use_cases.title: Cluster discovery
use_cases.description: Compute UMAP and Leiden clusters and review marker genes for cell type insights.

use_cases.title: Publication figures
use_cases.description: Generate high quality UMAP, heatmap, and dot plots for reports and papers.

prompt_templates.title: Quick QC run
prompt_templates.scenario: Filter a dataset and save outputs
prompt_templates.prompt: Run QC on input.h5ad with mt threshold 5, min genes 200, min cells 3. Save filtered data to qc_filtered.h5ad and list retained cells.

prompt_templates.title: Standard workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the analysis template to run normalization, PCA, UMAP, and Leiden clustering on data.h5ad with 40 PCs and resolution 0.5.

prompt_templates.title: Marker gene report
prompt_templates.prompt: After clustering, list the top 10 marker genes per cluster and save marker tables to the results directory.

prompt_templates.title: Trajectory analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run PAGA and DPT pseudotime on the Leiden clusters and generate UMAP plots colored by pseudotime.

output_examples.input: Filter a 10X dataset, cluster cells, and summarize markers.
output: Filtered to 6,975 cells and 15,402 genes using QC thresholds
Computed PCA, neighbors, UMAP, and Leiden clusters at resolution 0.5
Plots saved in figures/ with QC and UMAP outputs

best_practices: Inspect QC plots before selecting thresholds
Save raw counts in adata.raw before filtering genes
Try multiple Leiden resolutions and compare UMAP plots
anti_patterns: Running clustering without normalization and log transform
Using a single marker gene to label cell types
Overwriting raw data without saving a checkpoint

faq.question: Which platforms can I use this skill with?
faq.answer: It is designed for Python workflows and works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What data sizes are supported?
faq.answer: It depends on memory and CPU. Large datasets may need preprocessing or subsampling.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with my existing pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the scripts and template as modules or copy sections into your pipeline.

faq.question: Does it access my credentials or send data out?
faq.answer: No. The skill uses local files and does not include network or credential access.

faq.question: What if the input file does not load?
faq.answer: Check file format and path. Use .h5ad, 10X mtx, or CSV formats.

faq.question: How does it compare to other single cell tools?
faq.answer: It provides a Scanpy centered workflow and does not replace specialized tools like scVI or Seurat.
